title: Exquisite cakes
text: This is the place for edible artistry. If you want a cheap cake go to Safeway but if you want something that will impress this is the place

title: Finally opened
text: Had a recommendation from someone for this place. They said I had to try the Dutch crunch bread. I did and the sandwich approached perfection I had the Damon Bruce added mustard was very impressed by the sandwich and professional service I recommend it if you have not tried them you must!

title: great burgers!
text: a new spin-off of west side grill, brings the same high quality and expectations as the WestSide grill. Glad to see our restaurants adopting to COVID in creative ways

title: My idea of a pure beach
text: This was the first real ocean beach that I went to. It is an amazing stretch of coastline that stretches for miles. But the real unique draw for me is the sound. Waves breaking for miles along the shore make for an entrancing sound a background gentle roar punctuated by a crash of a wave. Then suddenly there will be a moment of complete silence before another wave crashes along the shoreline.

title: A hidden gem
text: Having grown up in Marin, Muir beach was always an option. The pelican inn adds to the charm. I was surprised at how far the efforts at eco restoration have progressed. Makes for a longer walk to the beach but a better experience.

title: Dark sand with small pebbles
text: The draw of this beach is its proximity to SF and the Golden Gate Bridge. Go through the tunnel to Ft Baker past Rodeo lagoon and on to the beach good running and hiking there as well

title: Old growth redwoods
text: The wife and I were here last weekend. It had been five years for me, thirty for her! Due to coronavirus parking and entrance requires reservations so as to limit the quantity of people in the park. It worked we were never too crowded on the paths and trails. The air was fresh and restorative.

title: Mt Tam means home
text: I grew up in Marin always under Mt Tam. I have hiked most of the side that faces Ross San Anselmo and Fairfax. The trails have been run and biked roads driven and a childhood lived with the sleeping lady.

title: Wonderful waterfront
text: The wife and I stayed here this past weekend. It was a great location and well insulated for sound. The breakfast was fantastic and varied. With vegan options. Rooms look out on Richardson bay. The room was comfy we were upgraded to a king room.

title: Sunday Brunch Delight
text: went here for the pizza but had the buckwheat crepes and a dessert crepe it was very laid back and casual.

title: excellent food, friendly owner
text: I tried this place for lunch. I went at 2pm, the website said they closed at 4 but due to covid they have closed at 2 but they were able to whip up a panini for me and it was sublime.

title: Great place to eat for decades!
text: I had not been here since the 80's when I worked in Palo Alto. It was a great restaurant then and it still is now! The wife and I went here for lunch last week and their outdoor dining was quite pleasant. Glad to see them weathering this storm.

title: Fresh fish!
text: I got the Poke Me! and it was wonderful. I know why people rave about Poke bowls now. My bowl had spring mix greens over warm rice with veggies, Hamachi, Ahi, salmon and roe. Loved it

title: NEW! delicious POKE bowls!
text: I have been waiting for this place to open, and now that they are I went there today. I got one of the Poke Me! bowls standard with wasabi. It was a sashimi salad, rice spring mix radishes cukes tuna, salmon hamachi and tobiko. Wonderful!

title: Tasty and large portions.
text: Tasty and large portions. Good service and friendly staff and a large menu. They were out of the ahi tuna so my wife had the shrimp tacos and I got a tri tip sandwich

title: Just the right stuff.
text: Just the right stuff. It was wonderful to go here for lunch. Sit outside and watch the boats while you eat. Fried and grilled fish and prawns.

title: Fast drive through
text: Went here for coffee and breakfast, the drive through service was very fast and friendly, my caramel macchiato was perfect, and the double smoked Bacon egg and cheese on a croissant was delish as usual.

title: Interesting concept
text: This place serves bubble teas and does optometry glasses for seeing and cups for drinking. I got the pina colada smoothie

title: Nice location
text: Went here today for lunch got their Rueben sandwich with fries. I love the marbled rye for a Rueben. It had the right amount of dressing and sour kraut the meat was tender and delicious. Even if you don’t golf try the restaurant though they are running a limited menu due to COVID-19.

title: self serve yogurt
text: Multiple flavors and toppings, currently practicing social distancing but open for business. I love these type of places, but I overbuy! it all looks so good, I can't help myself!

title: My favorite chain of Delis
text: So this is a local chain (CAL) that was started by two SJSU students as a class project, The first location had a walk up window, and no seating hence the name Togo. Their sandwiches are always good.

title: The other BR in MH
text: Their ice cream has been an American staple most of my life. The flavors never disappoint. Little know fact: discounted ice cream cones on the 31st of each month that has that many days

title: Always consistent quality
text: One of two BR in Morgan Hill. This one is tucked in with a Togo’s deli which is one of my favorite delis

title: A local chain
text: I love the food here, it is of constant quality whichever one you go to. Their lunch specials are what I get asit is always lunchtime when I go here.

title: Very healthy
text: Got a Abbott’s habit today although I asked for no sprouts they were on my sandwich anyway. Not bad I just prefer not to have them. Everything else was fine

title: Decent diner, small, obviously a local favorite
text: Went here with the wife for breakfast. The food was good for typical diner fare, lots of it and friendly staff. There is limited seating, so go early

title: Good BBQ
text: Went here for lunch today got the Tuesday special three pork ribs, (I got four) two sides bread and a drink. My sides were waffle fries and slaw

title: Very nice selection
text: Stopped here today before lunch and got the creme brûlée special boba tea I am enjoying it now. The service is friendly and fast

title: A unique experience
text: A 4.5 acre model of the SF bay and delta. Tidal cycles compresses 24 hours of tides to 15 minutes.salinity, depth ans flow rates are tested in the central lab

title: Interesting animals
text: An interesting place with llamas rabbits calves and younger animals as well as the ostriches right on 152 near San Felipe road junction

title: Korean paradise
text: They are open for takeout for lunch so I had to try it. The bulging I was tender and sweet with steamed rice and condiments. I also got some shrimp tempura appetizer they were crispy and delicious. Friendly and helpful staff I enjoyed my brief interaction when I picked up my food. Nice folks!

title: Full service food and drink
text: I was so happy to see my favorite marinara bagels so I got the sausage egg and cheese sandwich on one. It was delicious hot the spot

title: Scrumptious food
text: I got to try this place today and the first bite of my pulled pork sandwich made me pause before chewing it was so good

title: The third McDees in MH
text: Got a big Mac here today with fries and drink. The prices have increased a little (everywhere), but the quality is the same

title: First time at a Peets
text: Went here this am for coffee and breakfast. I avoided this place because I was not a fan of dark roast coffee but they have expanded and I bought some roasts online so I tried their coffee. My macchiato was very good the ham and cheese was fine and the almond croissant too.

title: Vegan delight
text: Not being vegan I have not tried a vegan pizza ever. So I was not sure how it would be. Let me tell you my vegan sausage and mushroom pizza was not only very tasty but I could not tell that the was no meat or dairy. While the pizza was smaller than expected definitely a personal pizza it was enough for me. The taste was perfect I did not miss anything. Even if you are not a vegan try this place.

title: Fresh and preserved fruit
text: I have drove past this place maybe one hundred times I finally went here. Got some huge cherries cherry salsa and a chocolate turtle. Those cherries are perfect sweet and tender.

title: An interesting shop
text: They have teas fruit drinks milkshakes and a few food plates. I got a Carmel milkshake it was like a cross between a thick milkshake and a slurpee. Also need to phone in orders for pick up.

title: New name: Tandoor Flames
text: They have reopened with a new name. I got chicken biryani and prawns tandoori. Just the right amount of heat and well spiced the prawns were delightful and tasty the chicken biryani was also good.

title: Another of three McD in MH
text: This is a nice place with a kids play room that many don’t have ( closed due to COVID-19). I found it to be clean and the staff was friendly

title: The other J in B
text: Got the southwestern cheese burger with curly fries and an Oreo shake. The food was less greasy than some other Jack in the Box restaurant

title: Just JinB
text: Love those greasy little fat bomb tacos though it is difficult to understand that delicious fresh tacos are to be had everywhere but their tacos are something different

title: One of three in Morgan Hill
text: If you have never been you must go. Otherwise it is a known quantity the menu is mostly the same across the nation

title: great food
text: Got the Texas Roadhouse burger with fries. The burger was delicious with sweet slaw bbq sauce bacon and onion ring. The fries were tasty but not crispy.

title: Mostly happy with the food
text: Got the Texas roadhouse BBQ burger today for lunch, it was HUGE and very good, high quality beef and veggies The onion ring, bbq sauce and sweet slaw made this burger delightful. In to each life some rain must fall: alas, my fries were not crisp, but soggy, tasty, but soggy.

title: Taco Bell two
text: I had the chalupa cravings box and a pineapple whip. The food was fine and the chain has been around for decades (but not in Mexico). I loved the bell Beefer but they only bring it back occasionally. It is the taco fillings on a bun.

title: Sweet croissants
text: Came this AM for donuts they do NOT have donuts, which was ok as the croissants were crispy and fresh

title: Good Chinese
text: Stopped here for dinner tonight. Got combo fried rice (good), ginger beef, (great with big pieces of ginger), mu-shu pork , (good with plenty of pancakes and sauce), and the cashew and almond shrimp ( slightly sweet but not as flavorful as the beef.

title: Great Mexican!
text: They are now open with outdoor dining. I got the mole enchilada lunch special. It was just the right amount of food. the mole was a wonderful mixture of heat and sweet!

title: Really good food off the beaten path
text: The family andI went here for lunch today based on a friend’s recommendation. Glad we did it was nice to sit outside at a restaurant again. My fish tacos were Devine my son was able to get a burger with a gluten free bun. My wife had the shrimp and crab fry special

title: Subway is fairly standard everywhere
text: Different subway today(there are three in this small town. I got a cold roast beef sandwich on sourdough. The bread was fresh. As were the veggies and the roast beef was high quality. Service was fast and friendly and all staff were wearing masks.

title: Came for juice drinks
text: Was here yesterday to pick up a couple of fruit drinks. The violet drink for my boss and the dragon drink for me. My dragon drink was refreshing and very tasty

title: a little slice of heaven
text: I got married to my first wife here (full military wedding) and I still like to visit when I'm on my way up to SF. The photo says it all a large reflecting pool (kept clean), and the water temple. There is a similar but larger structure in Sunol

title: My place of refuge
text: used to be up here several times a week. Now that I live away, I visit everytime I go home to San Anselmo. A "V" shaped lake tucked in to the side of mount Tamalpias. This man made lake has been a secret kept by locals. The first time I went to this lake with my friends (10 yo), the water district had drained it for repairs, I was so disappointed. Since then, I fished here, ran all over these hills I started running up to and then around this lake.

title: I like BK
text: The flame broiling brings out the flavor the whopper is big and lots of veggies on it. The fries were crispy and fresh.

title: Subway is reliable
text: Had lunch here today ordered online it was ready when I got there. I had a cheesesteak footlong the meat was melt in your mouth tender the spices and sauces were just the ticket.

title: Better meals around the corner
text: This is a convenience store that sells hot food to go. The quality is what you expect from the source. But they are here for the convenience and slurpees.

title: Very good for Pizza Hut
text: Got a pizza deal here this afternoon. Sausage mushrooms and ground beef with a thin crust. Got it hot out of the oven and it was very good. The sausage was well spiced as was the sauce. Despite the toppings a sauce can make or break a pizza a lackluster sauce can ruin an otherwise good pie.

title: Every bite is scrumptious
text: Waiting for them to open. Got lunch take out ordered online very easy interface. My chicken Parmesan was tender beyond belief, the sauce was sublime the potatoes were mashed with blended spices then fried up. The carrots were Alderney the beans were fine. Even the bread was made in-house and perfectly complimented the meal. No wonder this place is so popular!

title: Better PE than most
text: Went here for lunch today and was pleased at the service and the food. The orange chicken had a little heat in it. The walnut prawns were crispy and delicious and my grilled teriyaki chicken was tender and moist with their teriyaki sauce with a hint of ginger (love it).

title: Good and bad
text: I ordered the bacon cheese burger online today. The order process was seamless. The burger was fantastic cooked perfectly tasty with fresh veggies. The bad part was the fries they look great but were quite soggy. Not like that hasn’t happen elsewhere but they looked so good only to disappoint

title: Open at last
text: I had the Barron of beef sandwich today and it was fantastic. Beef cheese and tomato on toasted sourdough my mouth is watering just writing this. The French fries were crisp and fresh.

title: Top notch deli and groceries
text: Went here for lunch today. Got a beautiful roast beef sandwich it was perfect and my mouth watered while he made it. Picked up a Carmel white chocolate pear treat.

title: Better quality than some others
text: Got the chicken bbq and crispy shrimp appetizers both were great the chicken was tasty and moist. The shrimp was fresh and crispy

title: Panini and smoothie
text: Had lunch here today ordered with door dash from the TA site. I got a sirloin panini and a tropical smoothie. The panini was toasted perfectly and the smoothie has a flavor I can’t identify but I love it!

title: Standard KFC
text: Got lunch here today, a quick sandwich combo meal. it was good, hot and fresh. The service was fast and friendly.

title: Fast service tasty sandwiches
text: I got a hot roast beef sandwich Abbott’s habit the toasted roll is a nice touch the sandwich was great
place: Erik's DeliCafe Morgan Hill Cochrane Rd

title: Like they don't care
text: This place has been a blemish on the Mountain Mike's Franchise for at least twenty years. The first time I went I was disappointed twenty years ago, thought this weekend I would give it another try. The pizza was OK, but not up to the usual Mt Mike's quality and service was kind of surly. even just for pick up. I will never go to this location again as there is so much better pizza for the same or lower prices in Morgan Hill, including a new Mountain Mikes at Dunne and Condit where Hang Ten used to be.

title: Fairly standard for Chinese
text: The walnut prawns were mediocre, the shrimp was not fresh, nor was it crispy fried. The honey sauce was stock. The fried rice was a bit dry, and my chicken skewers had lots of sauce, but the sauce, (a variation of teriyaki) was ok. This is not a bad restaurant, but there are better Chinese in town.

title: No longer here, now Pearl River
text: This restaurant has changed its name to Pearl River Chinese Restaurant. Same location, possibly same owner, different name

title: Expected less but got more
text: I was not sure this would be good due to only one review and a limited menu due to COVID-19. I ordered the gen Tso’s chicken lunch special. The egg roll was fresh and not too greasy as they can get. The pork fried rice was quite good, the chicken chow menu was also good and not too greasy. The gen Tso’s chicken was grilled and the sauce was perfect. I was not expecting this level of quality. I recommend this place

title: As Denny’s go meh
text: I had the bourbon bacon burger with wavy fries and a vanilla shake. I have gotten this same dish at other Denny’s and they were better. The quantity of fries and milk shake were sub par. The burger was fresh but needed more of the signature bourbon sauce

title: Top of the field
text: The Family and I went here last summer and we were loving it. Some very impressive birds, but check the website for what is happening there. Sometimes during certain seasons the center will sequester certain species. Educational, entertaining, and scary (again, theses birds are impressive!)
place: World Center For Birds of Prey

title: Wonderful Italian
text: Lunch here today consisted of the grilled chicken sandwich with garlic fries. The sandwich was divine the pesto garlic and cheese was a perfect combination the garlic fries were good too. I am drooling at my food while typing this.

title: Standard for Little ceasars
text: So I know they don't have the highest quality of ingredients, but they have stuffed crust and they are the bomb when it comes to pizza technology and ease of order/pickup. I got the stuffed crust Sausage and Mushroom, my standard. The quality was what I expected not a bad pizza, but not great either

title: Like coming home
text: The friendliness with which I was greeted was so warm. The waiter was so cool and helpful. I had to try the mole enchiladas and it was superb the spices and flavors well balanced. And for the heck of it I got a crispy taco because my waiter waxed poetic about the crispy tacos. The carnitas was scrumptious. I want to return for dinner to try their Margaritas

title: More “Southwestern” than Mexican
text: Had their tacos today. Lots of chips, salsa was a bit watery. Service was very fast during COVID-19. Fare was standard for Chili’s good but not great I go here every so often never disappointed they are often crowded when seating is available. Order online for now pick up early.

title: Quality and quantity
text: Three tacos for lunch today the carne asada was moist and tender, the Al Pastor was tender and very tasty and finally the carnitas was melt in your mouth good. I can recommend all three although the next time I eat here I want to try the Mole Poblano.

title: Try it you will probably like it as much as I do
text: Had lunch here today I got the coconut shrimp appetizers and the charbroiled pork bang mi sandwich. The shrimp were very crispy and delicious but the pork sandwich was scrumptious just the right proportions of vegetables and meat on a fresh baked roll (baked fresh everyday). The owners are very friendly and personable

title: Decent food longish wait
text: This was ok food a bit pricey for wings and the fries were limp. It was also a bit of a wait but the food was hot and fresh
